main event: A round-shaped object was observed in the sky over Warwick Parrish, Bermuda on 8 August 1958.
interesting points: The object was reported to be the size of a planet and did not exhibit a tail or blinking lights., The object maintained a constant appearance until it disappeared., The duty officer communicated observations through a telex., The object had unusual speed as it frequently appeared and disappeared., The report speculated that it could be a satellite or possibly an astronomical phenomenon.
